item.title: Remove
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

xxxxxx 13:

Well your only bet is port forwarding. You shouldnt be able to break it LOL. Get someone who knows how to walk you through it. Its not difficult

had 3 different kids try to help me, they couldn’t figure it out. and the router i did break lost all contact to the internet lmao

item.title: Remove
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xxxxxx 13, post:2, topic:383184”]Nope. Right section.

Ok it could be a few things. Are you positive that your server is running on the correct port? I assume it probably is.

Are you sure its open? What kind of router do you have?

Also, this may sound stupid. But have you tried turning off windows firewall? Even with the exception sometimes it can block the transfer. My windows vista had the exception but i still had to turn off the firewall to run my server. It honestly won’t effect anything on your computer if you turn it off.[/quote]

I haven’t used my windows firewall in ages, its actually broken lmao. It cant update itself, and cant even connect to the windows server, so i had to shut it off otherwise it wouldn’t stop bugging me about its problems. I’m using an edition of mcafee that I’ve had for a long time now. but i don’t think thats it.
As for the router, Its a net-gear, what ever comcast sent us lol. i was going to port-forward it, but last time i tried i broke a 100$ router and didn’t want to do that again lol
And yes, my server has all the correct data entered for port and all that.
I’ve tried using port 5555 and it says:
Error: I could not see your service on 67.190.47.33 on port (5555)
Reason: Connection timed out
And then i get this when i use port 43594:
Error: I could not see your service on 67.190.47.33 on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out

Read full topic

item.title: Remove
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

Nope. Right section.

Ok it could be a few things. Are you positive that your server is running on the correct port? I assume it probably is.

Are you sure its open? What kind of router do you have?

Also, this may sound stupid. But have you tried turning off windows firewall? Even with the exception sometimes it can block the transfer. My windows vista had the exception but i still had to turn off the firewall to run my server. It honestly won’t effect anything on your computer if you turn it off.

Read full topic
